Row.Text: I'm not interested in this.
Nothing happens.
Rich Vein

A rich vein of blue marble was discovered at the quarry near the city. Your miners and masons have come to you to ask you what you would like to do with it.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Choose from the options below...
Boast of this, and merchants will come to buy it from us.
+{2_InstantYield}, and 10 turns of 'We Love the King Day' in the City.
Donate it to the Temple.
{2_InstantYield}.
Carve relics and idols from it.
{2_InstantYield}
Give it to our finest artists.
+2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture in the City for {5_Turns}.
Old Men and the Sea.
A band of local fishermen have appealed to the City for funding for a seasonal fishing expedition.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Choose from the following options...
Let's focus on something simple.
Spend {1_Scaled}. 50% Chance to gain +200 [ICON_FOOD] Food in the City.
A large investment will pay dividends.
Spend {1_Scaled}. 50% Chance that Fishing Boats near the City will gain +5 [ICON_FOOD] Food for {5_Turns}.
I'd rather invest in infrastructure.
Spend {1_Scaled}. A Harbor is constructed in the City.
The fishermen from {2_City} succeeded on their voyage, and have returned with a large haul of fish!{5_Help}
Fishing expedition successful!
The fishermen from {2_City} succeeded, and all Fishing Boats near {2_City} are producing +5 [ICON_FOOD] Food!{5_Help}
Fishing expedition successful!
Dramatic Masterpiece
Writers from the City have penned a new work, and critics are calling it a 'masterpiece.' News of this has reached your ear, and your advisors await your response.
Send news to the other civilizations of the world.
{1_YieldCost}. Gain {2_InstantYield} Tourism with all known Civilizations.
Let's celebrate this.
Gain {2_InstantYield}.
Make sure the writers are praised for this.
Gain {4_GPChange} points in the City.
They should have been praying instead.
Gain {2_InstantYield}.
Writers from {2_City} have penned a new dramatic work, attracting visitors from around the world.
Writers from {2_CityName} create a masterpiece.
Trouble at the Temple

Priests from the City demand that you weigh in on a religious debate. As the City grows, more and more people of different faiths are asking for use of the Temple. People of the majority faith resent this, and threaten violence if you allow nonbelievers into the Temple. Nonbelievers, however, threaten to leave if you do not let them in. What will you do?
Good riddance.
-1 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population in the City, and 2 turns of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance. Gain {2_InstantYield}.
Let them in, but make them pay for it.
Temple gains +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith. -1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness in City.
Reject the nonbelievers.
50% chance that the Temple is destroyed. If so, the city gains +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith and +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness.
The nonbelievers in {2_City} struck out at the Temple, burning it to the ground in protest. Your people are not shaken, however. City receives +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness, and: {5_Help}
Temple in {2_City} destroyed!
We should think bigger.
{1_YieldCost}. The Temple is destroyed, and a Grand Temple is built in its place.
Beacon of Hope
Fishermen in the City are concerned about the fate of the City's Lighthouse. In recent years it has fallen under disrepair, and it needs to be rebuilt. How should we deal with this?
Let private citizens manage it.
Lighthouse gains +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
The city should manage it.
Lose {1_YieldCost}. The Lighthouse gains +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Sell off the land.
Gain {2_InstantYield}. The Lighthouse is destroyed.
Hospital Overcrowding

Soldiers from the front pour into this City every day, and the wards are now filled with patients. Local doctors do not know what to do with the overflow, and have petitioned your government for support. What will you do?
Send emergency funding.
For the next {5_Turns}, the City produces -5 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, but gains +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness.
Triage is the only option.
Implement a triage system, saving those that we can. The City loses 1 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.
This is not our problem.
City produces -1 Happiness permanently.
Set up a permanent stipend for the Hospital.
City produces -5 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, but gains +2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness permanently.
Send all deceased to our Research Lab.
50% chance that the City will experience 3 turns of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance. If so, the Hospital gains +4 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
Cadavers were delivered to our Research Lab, however the public is outraged at our callousness.
Hospital science experiments discovered!
Stadium Sellout!
A game was held in your stadium as part of the WSO International! You gain 500 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism with all known Civilizations, and 500 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Game Day
The City's Stadium is preparing for game day! Unfortunately, it seems the manager misplaced his schedule, and he can't remember what kind of event is happening! What's going on here, again?
A skiing competition, obviously.
Gain 100 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and 75 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
Water sports, obviously.
Gain 100 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and 75 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
Pretty sure it was football. No, the American kind.
Gain 200 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Pretty sure it was football. Yeah, the real kind.
Gain 200 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
A sporting event? No, it was a ceremony.
Gain 400 [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age Points.
Nuclear meltdown!

The worst has happened. The City's Nuclear Plant has had a meltdown, rendering vast sections of the city uninhabitable. The building is destroyed, and all other buildings in the City are at risk. The City loses 5 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.
Drought
Drought has struck the City, crippling its [ICON_FOOD] Food output. For the next {5_Turns}, Farms produce -1 [ICON_FOOD] Food.
Severe Drought
Severe drought has struck the City, crippling its [ICON_FOOD] Food output. For the next {5_Turns}, Farms produce -1 [ICON_FOOD] Food, and a nearby Farm is pillaged.
Critical Drought
Critical drought has struck the City, crippling its [ICON_FOOD] Food output. For the next {5_Turns}, Farms produce -2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, and 2 nearby Farms are pillaged.
Exposure
Sub-zero temperatures have left many people in the City at risk to exposure. -1 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population in the City.
Fuel Shortage
Due to extreme cold, the City is currently experiencing a fuel shortage. Further supplies have been diverted from our industries to compensate. {1_YieldCost} towards the City's current task.
Frozen Waters
The city's river has frozen over, severely hampering commerce. -3 [ICON_GOLD] Gold in the City for {5_Turns}.
Bitter Winds
Bitterly cold winds are severely hampering production in the lands around the City. For {5_Turns}, all Quarries, Pastures, Farms, and Lumbermills produce -1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Mine Collapse
A mineshaft near the City has collapsed, killing all the workers and pillaging the Mine.
Forest Fire
Underbrush in a nearby Forest has set ablaze, forcing workers out of the Forest until the fires abate. Up to two Lumbermills near the City are pillaged.
Avalanche
Snow melt from a nearby mountain has collapsed, causing a massive avalanche. Up to two Villages and two Farms near the City are pillaged.
Local Corruption
Administrators in this City are currently facing charges of corruption. The people are angry, and demand some semblance of justice. A scapegoat is needed. Who will you blame?
The Minister of Agriculture is to blame.
{3_CityYield} in the City for {5_Turns}.
I knew the Corp of Engineers was up to no good.
{3_CityYield} in the City for {5_Turns}.
Someone's been stealing money from the treasury?
{3_CityYield} in the City for {5_Turns}.
I'll take the blame, I guess.
-2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness in the City for {5_Turns}.
Spoiled Food
A large portion of food in the Granary spoiled, no doubt due to mismanagement. {1_YieldCost} in the City.
Bandits!
Bandits assaulted your tax collectors, making off with the money! {1_YieldCost}.
Great Harvest
Farmers in the City report an excellent harvest this season. +{2_InstantYield} in the City.
Market Day
Market Day has begun, and the City's marketplace is filled with customers. For the next {5_Turns}, the City's Market produces +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Eruption!

Oh no! A once-dormant mountain near the City has suddenly erupted, pouring down lava into the City and the surrounding countryside! Effects: -3 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population in the City, multiple Improvements are pillaged, and many City buildings are damaged!
Krakatoa Erupts!

Krakatoa has erupted! Massive plumes of ash, smoke, and lava have enveloped the nearby City and its countryside. Effects: -3 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population, Improvements are pillaged, and many Buildings are damaged!
Resort near Natural Wonder
As a result of the tourism generated by a nearby Natural Wonder, a business consortium decided to construct a Hotel in this City.
Pestilence
A blight has devestated the farmland near this City. Up to two Farms near the City are pillaged.
Floods
The City's river has flooded, devastating the nearby farmland and damaging the City's buildings. Up to 3 Farms are pillaged, and some buildings may be destroyed as well.
Hurricane approaches

A hurricane looms on the horizon, and is headed straight for the City. It may or may not hit the city. If it does, expect major losses of life and property. The City's council is unsure of how to respond, and looks to you for guidance.
Evacuate the City and sandbag everything.
Lose 1000 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. The City is well-prepared for the hurricane.
Buckle down and hope for the best. There's nothing we can do.
No preparation. Good luck!
Send in the military to protect property.
Lose 500 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. If the hurricane hits, expect large losses of life.
Send in the military to protect the populace.
Lose 500 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. If the hurricane hits, expect major property damage.
Our river's levee will protect us from surge water!
Lose 500 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and rely on the river's levee. If the hurricane hits, expect major property damage.
Hurricane strikes {2_City}!
A very powerful Hurricane struck {2_City}. Thankfully, the City was well-prepared, and was minimally damaged.
A very powerful Hurricane struck {2_City}. The City was not well-prepared, and was horribly damaged.
A very powerful Hurricane struck {2_City}. The City itself was well-protected, but the population suffers.
A very powerful Hurricane struck {2_City}. The City's population was well-protected, but the City itself was decimated.
A very powerful Hurricane struck {2_City}. The City's levee did not hold, and the City was devastated.
Plague!
Our worst fears have come true. Plague has reached the City! People lay dead in the streets, and hundreds more die every day. Effect: -15 [ICON_FOOD] Food in the City for {5_Turns}.
Mysterious Wanderer

A cloaked figure lingers outside the City's Walls. When asked why he has come to the city, he hands the guard a tattered letter:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I am a man of many talents, but I have no home. Mute since birth, I teach and train without words. I can offer you one of four talents in exchange for hospitality and a home."
"The gift of the artist."
Gain {4_GPChange} in the City.
"The gift of the craftsman."
Gain {4_GPChange} in the City.
"The gift of the soothsayer."
Gain {4_GPChange} in the City.
"The gift of the trader."
Gain {4_GPChange} in the City.
Nomadic Incursion

A group of nomadic peoples have appeared at your borders, and petition for the right to settle in your territory. They seem friendly, and are willing to negotiate in order to gain what they desire. How do you respond?
Give them land, but only if they adapt to our culture.
Gain {2_Instant} towards Border Growth in this City (only affects Border Growth).
Drive them out, and steal whatever we can take.
Receive {1_Cost}. 50% chance that two Barbarian units will spawn near the City.
Invite them to settle, but only if their finest soldiers join our army.
A free military Unit spawns near your City.
Invite them to integrate into the City, so that we may learn of their culture.
City gains 1 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizen. +{4_GPChange} in the City.
Your brazen actions angered the nomads, and they have declared war on you! Two Barbarian units spawn near {2_City}.
Nomadic retaliation against {2_City}!
Trouble Brewing

Threats against your rule continue to grow in the City, and your advisors are worried that it may spill over into violence. You need to root out this resistance before it grows too strong. Your options are limited, however:
They'll never expect the inqusition!
The City loses 5 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.
Bait the rebels out - we'll crush them with our military power.
Four Rebel units spawn near the City, and the City enters [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance for 3 Turns.
Quarantine the rebels. They may take part of the city, but that's unavoidable.
15% chance that each building in the City will be destroyed.
